item.title: Geisha-in-training hit the streets of Tokyo
item.description: Maiko, young apprentice geisha, try to drum up a tourism revival for typhoon-hit Kyoto
item.ExtractedText: << Previous Â Next >> A group of young apprentice geisha -- the oldest is 20 years old -- make a special appearance in Tokyo as part of a campaign called "We are alive and well, Kyoto." The promotion is part of efforts to lure tourists back following last month's floods, the result of Typhoon Man-yi. For centuries, one of Kyoto's biggest draws has been the sight of traditional geisha heading to their evening engagements. Loading weather data ...
